BALEEN: The bony material that makes up the plates in the mouth of the ______ whale, Mysticeti, which it uses to trap its food; formerly used in corsetry
BELUGA: A cetacean, Delphinapterus leucas, found in the Arctic Ocean.
BLUE: The colour of the clear sky or the deep sea, between green and violet in the visible spectrum, and one of the primary additive colours for transmitted light; the colour obtained by subtracting red and green from white light using magenta and cyan filters; or any colour resembling this.
GRAY: An achromatic colour intermediate between black and white.
HUMPBACK: A humped back (deformity in humans caused by abnormal curvature of the upper spine).
ORCA: A sea mammal (Orcinus ____) related to dolphins and porpoises, commonly called the killer whale.
SPERM: The reproductive cell or gamete of the male; a _____atozoon.
